image.altText: A woman shears a sheep as two men watch.

props.synopsis: The 37-year-old mother-of-four managed a running average of 72.3 seconds per lamb to secure a place in the shearing record books.

title.children: Yass woman shears 395 merino lambs in 8 hours, setting world record

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: The crown prosecution in a manslaughter trial says no-one was at risk of injury from a 95-year-old great-grandmother who died after she was tasered by a police officer.

title.children: Jury hears police officer who tasered a 95yo woman was 'fed up, impatient, not prepared to wait any longer'

image.altText: A woman stands in front of microphones, with a man behind her looking at her.

props.synopsis: Canberra Liberals leader Leanne Castley has unveiled her new shadow cabinet following the election last month.

title.children: Canberra Liberals drop dedicated climate change portfolio in shadow cabinet

image.altText: An animation of old photos, with a focus on a woman panning out to around 50 others.

props.synopsis: The National Archives of Australia has digitised over a million service records from World War II, many of which haven't been seen for 80 years.

title.children: Merle was one of many who served in WWII. Aged 104, she's seeing her records for the first time

image.altText: Lauren Jackson arrives for the Sport Australia Hall of Fame, posing on the red carpet in a black evening dress

props.synopsis: Lauren Jackson has been celebrated for her courage and bravery, with the basketball great revealing she competed in her fifth Olympics in Paris just a month before a knee replacement.

title.children: Basketball great Jackson reveals she needed a knee replacement while winning bronze for Australia at Olympics

image.altText: A person wearing a backpack stands in a forest of lush greenery, ferns and tall trees.

props.synopsis: No trace has ever been found of missing Cessna 210 VH-MDX, despite 43 years of searching Barrington Tops National Park in New South Wales.

title.children: VH-MDX vanished without a trace 43 years ago with five people onboard. These people are still searching

image.altText: A yellow 'road closed' sign across a road with clothing and other items scattered in the background.

props.synopsis: The 48-year-old woman was struck by a utility on Bicentennial Drive at around 8:15am on Sunday. She died at the scene.

title.children: Female pedestrian dies after being hit by ute in Jerrabomberra

image.altText: a woman with dark red hair and a green top in a park

props.synopsis: She's one of many Canberra endometriosis patients who have been forced to go private for surgery, costing them thousands of dollars in the process.

title.children: Katherine waited more than three years for a surgery which could have eased some of her endometriosis pain

image.altText: A woman stands in a garden, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The scandal threatening to engulf Australia's superannuation industry has spread to another major operator, Australian Ethical, which has apologised for taking almost a year to process a widow's application to access her dead husband's retirement savings.

title.children: Superannuation crisis spreads to sustainable-branded fund Australian Ethical

image.altText: Elderly woman holds a phone up to her ear

props.synopsis: Aged Care Minister Anika Wells indicates she supports regularly publishing data on how long older Australians are stuck waiting for Commonwealth-funded aged care help. Follow live.

title.children: Aged care wait times could be published to 'improve transparency'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Assistant treasurer has heard 'crickets' from the opposition regarding new anti-scam bill
UK suggests Australia will be joining nuclear energy pact in snafu
Aged care wait times could be published under changes afoot

image.altText: woman looking through fence

props.synopsis: This global religious sect has restrictions around television, eating with others and attending university. Its members also run schools and a charity that have received millions of dollars in funding from taxpayers.

title.children: Former Brethren members speak out about life in a religious sect

image.altText: Old man and young woman sitting on a sofa playing cards

props.synopsis: Like a good wine, the boomers are getting richer with age. But it's coming at the expense of young people, and one day they might just pull the cork out.

title.children: The Boomers may be getting richer with age, but things could turn sour at any moment

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands in front of flags of Australia and China.

props.synopsis: The Chinese president has spoken of the "twists and turns" in recent relations with Australia during talks with Anthony Albanese on the sidelines of the G20 summit.

title.children: Xi Jinping urges Anthony Albanese to manage China relations with 'great care' in G20 meeting

image.altText: A young woman with brown hair wearing a white dress stands in front of a bright cafe looking at the camera

props.synopsis: More than 6 million people have been forced to leave Ukraine since Russia launched its illegal invasion in 2022, but some people have built new lives elsewhere while remaining determined to one day rebuild their homeland.

title.children: Russia's invasion of Ukraine forced 6 million refugees to seek a new life elsewhere

image.altText: An elderly woman walks with her head high flanked by a man in his 50s looking tired, both wearing black coats

props.synopsis: The children of Dominique Pelicot, who is on trial for orchestrating men to join him in drugging and raping his wife over a decade, tell of their shock and grief during his trial in a French court.

title.children: Gisele Pelicot's children speak of 'trial of entire family' as daughter alleges she was also abused

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has opened higher on Tuesday. Woolworths faces another grilling at the ACCC's supermarkets inquiry. Tesla shares rallied on Wall Street. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX rises, Woolworths faces supermarket probe

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: HESTA to make payments to members impacted by March 2020 valuations

image.altText: Chris Murphy exists a police station.

props.synopsis: The lawyer for veteran broadcaster Alan Jones has criticised a senior police officer and confirmed his client will defend himself against historical indecent assault and sexual touching charges.

title.children: Alan Jones's lawyer slams senior police officer's comment as 'contemptible' and vows to fight charges

image.altText: Woman in wheelchair at graduation ceremony

props.synopsis: Jade McAlear sustained multiple fractures and was in a coma in Royal Melbourne Hospital for four months. She is now living with an acquired brain injury (ABI).

title.children: Jade lives with acquired brain injury and wants people to stop treating her like a child

image.altText: Sam Kerr of the Matildas signs the shirt of her partner Kristie Mewis after a match

props.synopsis: Matildas captain Sam Kerr target of homophobic abuse after revealing she is having a baby with her fiancee Kristie Mewis.

title.children: Sam Kerr subjected to homophobic abuse after announcing first child with partner Kristie Mewis

image.altText: Nana Backpacker Hostel

props.synopsis: The two teenage girls from Melbourne are reportedly fighting for their lives in Thai hospitals after drinking suspected tainted cocktails in Laos.

title.children: Melbourne teens in hospital after drinking suspected tainted cocktails in Laos

image.altText: People holding up alcoholic cocktails

props.synopsis: Two Australian teenagers are fighting for their lives in Thai hospitals after consuming drinks suspected to contain methanol in Laos.

title.children: What is methanol poisoning and how can I protect myself?

image.altText: Cassandra Barratt and Archie 1

props.synopsis: The gender pay gap — the difference in average pay between Australian men and women — is 11.5 per cent, which is the equivalent of working from November 19 until the end of they year without being paid for it.

title.children: Gender pay gap means 'today is the day that women effectively start working for free'

image.altText: A person in camouflage gear stands next to a large truck with piles of white bags on it.

props.synopsis: The convoy was travelling through southern Gaza on Saturday when the UN's Palestinian aid agency UNRWA says it was set upon by armed gunmen.

title.children: UN says more than 100 aid trucks in Gaza have been lost to looting

image.altText: An older woman looking angrey near a riverbed

props.synopsis: Sela Vosikata has lived in her Fijian village her whole life — and she has a simple message for the world's leaders: come here and see it for yourself.

title.children: Fijian villagers facing relocation due to climate change have message for Donald Trump

image.altText: Pamela Rabe, a middle-aged-woman, wearing glasses, her greying hair pulled back, narrows her eyes, a cigarette in her fingers.

props.synopsis: Pamela Rabe has been a star of Australian stage and screen for more than 40 years. Now, she takes on a new challenge: playing the matriarch in August: Osage County.

title.children: Wentworth's Pamela Rabe plays the monstrous lead in this Tony and Pulitzer-winning show that pulls no punches

image.altText: A woman outside court

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old girl has been charged with driving without due care and attention causing death. She's set to be sentenced next week.

title.children: Queensland woman who lost her unborn baby in car crash 'relieved' the case is before the courts

image.altText: A manufacturing staff member wearing orange hi-viz clothing kneeling alongside yellow machinery and handling black cabling

props.synopsis: The federal government has announced the first recipient of taxpayer investment under the National Reconstruction Fund, with "a dozen" more announcements promised before the election.

title.children: Queensland mining equipment firm gets $40 million in taxpayer funds in first National Reconstruction Fund announcement

image.altText: Teenage students solve maths problems in workbooks.

props.synopsis: Spelling mistakes and incorrect questions have been identified in several year 11 and 12 exams in Tasmania. One concerned parent says it left her son "rattled".

title.children: Teacher says end-of-year exam was 'borderline disgraceful' after students find incorrect questions

image.altText: A close-up of illuminated buttons on a pokies machine.

props.synopsis: Plans for a mandatory card for pokies players limiting how much money they could lose has been shelved in Tasmania, with critics claiming it is a win for the gaming industry.

title.children: 'The pokies lobby wins again': Tasmania puts off mandatory pre-commitment card

image.altText: A shot of Windsor Castle and some of its surrounding grounds. Crowds of people walk along the road to its entry

props.synopsis: British police are investigating a burglary on the Windsor Castle estate in which two vehicles were stolen.

title.children: Masked men steal vehicles from Windsor Castle estate after scaling fence

image.altText: Perry Kouroumblis

props.synopsis: The Italian government has signed off on Australia's request to extradite Perry Kouroumblis, who was arrested in September in relation to the 1977 Easey Street murders.

title.children: Prime suspect in notorious Melbourne double murder set to be extradited to Australia from Italy

image.altText: A close up family photo of a woman and man and two young kids.

props.synopsis: Queensland man Dale Simpson should be getting ready for his engagement party this weekend. Instead, his family is preparing for his funeral after a tragic mountain bike accident.

title.children: Dad killed in mountain biking accident days before his engagement party

image.altText: Queensland Parliament House, 2022.

props.synopsis: MPs who lose their seat are eligible for a payout worth 12 weeks of their salary but an association representing former members says it should be more.

title.children: 'Unfair' $42,000 payment to voted-out MPs should be doubled, says former speaker

image.altText: Elderly woman sits on her bed longingly holding an old black and white photo of her younger self next to her late husband.

props.synopsis: When Shirley met the love of her life at age 19, Australian society didn't allow her and her soulmate to be together.

title.children: Chance meeting sparks love story that endured White Australia heartache
